entry.value: How was the baby feeling before going to sleep.
How was the baby feeling after waking up.
Enum with many values to be specified. Examples: in car, cosleeping, in his own bed etc.
Carer filling the form sees minute intervals as options, frontend should map them to the regex values.
Relevant only for the night sleep.
Relevant only for the night sleep.
Relevant only for the night sleep. Time in which the baby was not asleep during the night (in minutes).
The value may be null, this means: take default value for a baby, according to its age.

Entity which stores all historical values of assigned nap count. It is required in app (we can't access Datomic history). Do not delete entities unless you are sure that the data is old enough. The assigned nap count for a baby in a moment t is the napCount value of the newest SNAssignedNapCount with createdAt <= t.
Deprecated. Instead of modifying this value, create new SNAssignedNapCount entity.
Deprecated. 1: All ok, 2: Sleepyhead, 3: Inverted rhythm, 4: Bad naps, OK night sleep, 5: All bad
Deprecated. 0: 0-4 days of data, 1: 4 days + >=3 days in last 7 days, 2: 10 days + >=0.5 ratio (fall back on <0.4)
Used for testing: to create predictions in a day in the future, set this field to that day. If set to empty, remove all testing predictions. Should be always empty outside of testing.
This field might be empty if the baby is not born yet.

This field might be empty if the baby entity was created after the birth and it is not a premature baby. Being a premature baby is determined based on the difference between the expected and the actual date of birth.
Used for testing predictions.
If missing, the baby is awake.
Not the main owner: the other parent, grandparent, nanny etc.
The carer who has created the baby.
Language of the interface and all course materials.
Only one person can be the main carer of a baby, so this relation is for other carers - the other parent, grandparents, nannies etc.
Owner of the baby in the system. Carer can have many babies only if it is a premium user.
ISO 639-1: two letter code, lowercase
ISO 639-1: two letter code, lowercase. This is not the language of the interface, but the language of the content created.
Setting this to null means the course isn't paused
Config entries with this flag should be added to the course right after its created - before the questionnaire is completed
Should always be set together with questionnaireFieldValue

Should always be set together with questionnaireFieldName. Is interpreted in a different way depending on the type of the field:
1. For multiple choice questions the condition is met when the option specified in this field is one of the selected options
2. For boolean fields this field should be either "true" or "false"
3. Fields of string type should exactly match the value specified in this field

These values should be interpreted after configs matching baby's age and questionnaire answers are selected. After this pass, for all rules chapterTemplates of which are not blocked, the rules containing their blockedChapters should be removed.

Entries used to determine what chapters should be included in user's course. They should be first considered when creating course - the entries with `isIntroChapter` should be immediately attached. Next, they should be considered when the SNCourseQuestionnaireAnswers objects are created.
Multiple choice question; values should be separated by ", "
Multiple choice question; values should be separated by ", "
Multiple choice question; values should be separated by ", "
Used for displaying info on how long completing the mission will take on the frontend in a format of `${estimatedTimeInMinutesLowerBound} - ${estimatedTimeInMinutesUpperBound} min`
Used for displaying info on how long completing the mission will take on the frontend in a format of `${estimatedTimeInMinutesLowerBound} - ${estimatedTimeInMinutesUpperBound} min`
ISO 639-1: two letter code, lowercase
ISO 639-1: two letter code, lowercase
Do not confuse with app/active! Here active should mean ,,the provider will accept payment with this instrument''.
ID of the instrument, created by the provider
ISO 4217: three letter code, uppercase
If true, use when child is not assigned to any cohort. If false, use to determine whether already assigned child should leave the cohort.
Weights used in decision tree when deciding on baby's cohort.
Deprecated, will be removed!
If true, apply to first activity window. Otherwise, apply to next activity windows or naps.
Deprecated, will be removed!
group0 not available: we are not making predictions for this group
For a baby assigned to a cohort, all weights used to compute recommended times of napping or night sleeping.
Netto, add taxAmount to get total!
ISO 4217: three letter code, uppercase
There should be maximumMonths > minimumMonths
There should be maximumMonths > minimumMonths
Unit dependent on variable name: percentage, minutes, 1/0 (true/false)
According to the spreadsheet, variables have cryptic names, such as x, y, z.
Table 1.2: corrections
There should be maximumMonths > minimumMonths
There should be maximumMonths > minimumMonths
Unit dependent on variable name: amount (of naps), minutes, or minutes past midnight.
Might be used to define nth activity period or nth nap, in this case this index is n
Table 1.1: age-based recommendations, full variable name is variableName + variableSubName + variableIndex
ISO 639-1: two letter code, lowercase
Used for sections of type "image" and "video"
Used together with mediaWidth for sections of type "image" and "video"
Optional thumbnail for sections of type "video"
Used together with mediaHeight for sections of type "image" and "video"
Mandatory for sections of type "markdown", "quote" and "header". Used for displaying optional caption for sections of type "image" and "video".
This entity records only historical sleeps.
Used for selecting one of predefined icons that can be used for bullet points of unordered lists
Type of enumeration used for ordered lists: numerical (1., 2., 3., ...) or alphabetical (A., B., C., ...)
ISO 639-1: two letter code, lowercase
ISO 639-1: two letter code, lowercase
ISO 4217: three letter code, uppercase
Possible values depend on provider

Buyable = true means that the subscription can be selected to be bought. If buyable = false, subscription can be bought by users who have already selected it. Migrate them to new subscription if you want to prevent them from buying this subscription.
There should be at most one template per provider with this flag set to true.
Always plural: years, months, weeks, ...
If true, subscription can't be bought more than once (eg. trial).
Deprecated, will be removed! JSON encoded additional properties of template, not expressed in schema.
Tier 1 is the best subscription tier, tier 2 is lower tier, etc.
ISO 4217: three letter code, uppercase
Possible values depend on provider
Used for displaying info on how long reading the subchapter will take on the frontend in a format of `${estimatedTimeInMinutesLowerBound} - ${estimatedTimeInMinutesUpperBound} min`
Used for displaying info on how long reading the subchapter will take on the frontend in a format of `${estimatedTimeInMinutesLowerBound} - ${estimatedTimeInMinutesUpperBound} min`
If any are added, an additional slide with the checkboxes will be shown at the end of this subchapter
Deprecated, use firstName and lastName.
Not empty only for app users.
Not empty only for content managers.
